page.title: 20PONDS AND LOCHS OF CROY
page.content: In Croy there are about four ponds and one Loch.Kilravock pond is used by nearly every one for boating.It was dug out in case there was a fire.In the middle it is about five feet deep and that is the deepest part of it. The pond has never been used in a fire.It is said that deep in the depths of Loch Flemington sits a deserted castle and that the island the castle stood on sunk.Swans,duck and other water creatures inhabit the Loch.Loch Flemington is one and a half miles from Croy.It is used for boating,swimming and fishing.In the winter when the loch freezes up it is used for curling.
